subject: Re: Re: Re: New customer question
description_text:
I did as requested but the disconnections still persist. I also installed a
ground-only socket to ground the entire system but it didn't work. The
plugs are and were already 3-prong.


Il giorno gio 11 dic 2025 alle 08:35 support@simsonn.com <
support@simsonn.com> ha scritto:

> Hi Federico Simoncini,
>
> If this happens, it indicates that the computer’s grounding is not
> reliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used with a
> three-prong wall outlet. You can refer to the post below: connect the
> computer case to the stand, and connect the control box to the metal screws
> on the pedals. This should resolve the disconnection issue.
>
> https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting
>
> https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding
>
>
> On Tue, 9 Dec at 1:30 PM
>
> , Federico Simoncini <federicosic9@gmail.com> wrote:
>
> Good morning. I bought the Prox Ultra control unit and the vibration power
> increased slightly, but it didn't solve a problem I thought it would. Every
> 15-20 minutes the VAMs turn off and make a strange buzzing sound that only
> goes away by disconnecting the standard VAM from the accelerator. To
> restart them, completely disconnect the control unit and reconnect it. One
> time, the VAM Pro (brake) stopped working while I was racing and it
> vibrated continuously for 15 minutes.
>
> Motor 1: standard vam
> Motor 2: vam pro
>
>

> support@simsonn.com> ha scritto:
>
> Hi Federico Simoncini,
>>

>> the ProX Ultra control unit, as its hardware supports bidirectional control

conversations.body_text: Hi Federico Simoncini,     Most importantly, use a wire to securely connect the PC chassis to the screws on the main control box, ensuring a common ground. This helps improve system stability and reduce interference.
